intro: Teline nervosa, commonly known as the slender teline, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream sides. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family. Teline nervosa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
